metadata.title: CVE-2018-6044 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
** REJECT ** DO NOT USE THIS CANDIDATE NUMBER. ConsultIDs: CVE-2018-16064.Reason: This candidate is a reservation duplicate of CVE-2018-16064. Notes:All CVE users should reference CVE-2018-16064 instead of this candidate.All references and descriptions in this candidate have been removed toprevent accidental usage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
